summary: Martian ruler Kimar (Leonard Hicks) is upset that the children of Mars are lazy and under the influence of too much pop culture from Earth. They are obsessed with the planet's television programs and don't want to do much of anything. In an attempt to get the kids peppy again, Kimar orders the kidnapping of Santa Claus (John Call), hoping that the jolly old toymaker will know how to cheer the children up again. But two Earth children are also nabbed, and this complicates things for Kimar.

reviews.content: I watched this movie on a dare between watching this or letting a tarantula crawl on me. In hindsight, I should have gone with the spider
This is a so bad it's good film. It is definitely outdated but still fun to watch and make fun of. I would love to see a remake.
Great movie. This is a must see if it's late at night and your hanging out with your friends.

A lot better than you would be expecting. There's a lot of great science fiction Concepts in relation to the Martians. Prophetic technology. And ultimately the alien species needing something of our Humanity for the holiday.
What a terrible movie, I hated every bit of this film.

In almost all ways I can think of, Santa Claus Conquers the Martians is a pretty terrible film.  Now, there are numerous good things I can say, at the very least:  There is some creativity behind the concept, the way that Santa is treated as semi-magic and semi-believably realistic is a neat approach (like how negative people can become optimistic simply by being near him long enough, like some kind of Joy Radiation), the acting by the adults is adequate, and I like how the main Martian character actually treats Santa and the kids with a sincere respect and compassion is genuinely nice.  However, the movie makes way too many miscalculations, as well as fails on a number of fundamental levels, to be enjoyable (outside of the MST3K treatment).  Perhaps the most glaringly obvious flaw is that over 90% of the movie takes place in a spaceship, or on Mars, meaning that there's nothing like snow, carolers, Christmas decorations or trees, and even any Christmas music (despite most of it being Public Domain by the time this film was made); this is further hampered by the fact that there is primary Plot Thread in the latter half about making gifts, but all of these gifts are shown on their own (without any packaging/bows/wrapping paper).  This results in a Christmas movie with virtually no Christmas visuals whatsoever, outside of the presence of Santa that is.  Worse, the film then drops most of the previous Plot Threads and instead turns into a Social Commentary of the negatives of Mass Production due to Industrial Efficiency, and not in any meaningful way, like pollution or the replacement of workers with automation; instead it just goes with some Old-Man Logic (for lack of a better term) of "Things not made by hand just aren't the same," despite nothing involving the automation itself actually causing any problems, such as easily-broken toys.  But perhaps worst of all, the movie has an almost invisible Tone; for the most part I can't tell if it's trying to be a Fantasy/Sci-Fi, a simplistic Children's film, an outright Comedy/Dramedy or what, but then it ends with a climax that is purely played for laughs, and in the most loud and in-your-face way imaginable.  Seriously, it literally ends with a group of alien warriors (literally there to commit murder!!) getting defeated by a ton of bouncy-balls, squirt-guns and bursts of confetti!  Now, half of the blame can also be placed at the feet of the writing and directing as well, which just makes this Climax clash in Tone from the rest of the movie, and attempts to make this funny, but instead just makes it loud, obnoxious, jarring and, I'll say it again: LOUD!  This might be the most headache-inducing climax I can recall, capping off what was a work of Low-Tier Mediocrity with unquestionably the worst part of the movie, capped off with an equally loud ending song (repeated from the opening) that just left me exhausted after watching.  It's a Christmas movie, so by virtue of this classification you're supposed to feel SOMETHING else, such as joy, enthusiasm or a sense of wonder, but no, this movie just made me feel drained.  Sad, as the entire movie is bad, but the first two Acts were at least watchable, only to be capped off by a genuinely awful crescendo.  Ah well - at last the MST3K episode is pretty great.
I'm honestly not sure how something like this got made. The title says it all for you...

Ho, ho, oh no! Santa Claus Conquers the Martians is just a complete failure. For starters, this film was so painful to watch, it felt like I watched the movie for three dreadful hours. Speaking of painful, the acting was beyond bad that this film came off as genuinely painful. The writing is also painful because the story of aliens capturing Santa to bring Christmas to their planet after discovering Earth is outright ridiculous all because if sentient lifeforms actually found the planet Earth for the first time in 4.5 billion years, I personally doubt they would be interested in the planet's holiday traditions. Horrible costumes that look like they were homemade as an arts and crafts project for some kid's elementary school. The makeup was also bad since the people behind this film just took a stereotypical Martian look and put it on the actors. Awful music as well especially since the opening song is annoying, high-pitched, and even sounds actually distorted and like it was recorded by a really old or low-functioning camera. What was also dreadful was the phony special effects and fake fighting. It was neither special nor effective. Santa Claus Conquers the Martians has failures all across the board: annoying music, wooden acting, cheap costumes, lazy writing, pathetic makeup, phony visuals, fake fighting, and cheesy art direction. Santa Claus Conquers the Martians is nothing more than a hunk of coal.
This movie is so bad you have to watch it,  I laughed all the way
Santa's laugh gave me nightmares
A very strange but boring movie this sci fi is worth riffing but for everyone else the title is epically bad but it's not worth watching

While it's funnier to see a riffing on this movie rather than watching the actual movie itself, Santa Claus Conquers the Martians is still an entertaining "so bad, it's good" movie. While the two unironic redeeming qualities this B-movie has are the Martians' costume design and the sincerity the actor playing Santa brings to the character, everything else... There're unconvincing fight scenes, characters behaving like idiots, a ridiculous script, etc. You can't say this doesn't stand out amongst other Christmas movies, though.
This movie is so bad it's good - well, the MST3K version anyway. we made a parody christmas horror host show out of this and had a blast!!
3 words ï¿ 1/2~Mystery...... Science.......Theaterï¿ 1/2~.
This movie deserves a much better reputation then it has.  Speaks more to modern snarkiness, then the movie itself.  I really enjoyed this when I was a kid and still enjoy it now.

it was awful!!!!! I knew it would be bad but never expected it to be THIS bad. The effects are inexcusable, especially during  a time with James Bond and the wizard of oz!!!! The martians don't even look like martians,then there's the polar bear which is so half-assed it's just hilarious. The robot is Also terrible. Plus at several parts you can literally hear the set crew laughing, like after someone says something about the smokestack of the queen elizabeth. It wasn't even funny!!!! Most of the time I forget this is even supposed to be a christmas movie!!!it has absolutely NOTHING to do with christmas except that it has santa claus in it. The only reason this isn't a lower rating is because it's so bad it is hilarious.
If I just review based on the content I say 2/10
if I take into consideration how hilariously awful it is then 6/10
A pretty damn terrible christmas film, but also one of the BEST WORST films i've ever seen! Recommend the MST3K and Rifftrax versions the most!!

If this film wanted to engage kids at a level a braindead salamander could comprehend, it failed. But for us adults, it is the best so-bad-it's-good Xmas movie out there. Pia Zadora is in this one as a child actress - her Midas touch of suckiness would apparently carry over into the '80s when she was the star of "Voyage of the Rock Aliens."
Hailed as one of the worst films ever, it really was.

Santa Claus Conquers the Martians (1964) ??
One of the all-time greats. Martians kidnap Santa Claus because there is nobody on Mars to give their children presents. Got that? Now forget it. Grade Z junk.

I still very much appreciate its spirit, both in terms of no-budget
filmmaking and sense of fun. I wish that the films of today could have
even a fraction of its good-natured mischievous approach. Certainly film studios could learn a thing or two, in this ridiculous era of quarter-of-a-billion-dollar blockbusters. I for one don't need the equivalent of 'having my eyes masturbated', as one cinema critic so lovingly stated.

I would prefer watching this in a second over any of the ham-fisted,
cash-soaked holiday atrocities made in the past three decades (I
believe 'A Christmas Story', and perhaps 'Elf' and 'National Lampoon's
Christmas Vacation' to be the last decently-made Yuletide films).

But don't take MY word for it...see it for yourself (without the stupid
and condescending MST3K commentary) and make your OWN conclusion.

Santa Claus Conquers the MartiansÂ is geared entirely towards children, and was designed to be a harmless bit of Holiday fun that the whole family can enjoy. In fact, the only thing preventing it from becoming a Christmas classic is itâ??s an absolutely terrible movie, with an awful storyline and horrible make-up and costumes (the Martians wear green tights and have some sort of metallic paint smeared all over their faces). Even the stock footage, some of which was on-loan from the U.S. military, makes no sense (following a report that an alien ship is in orbit around earth, there are clips of pilots leaping into state-of-the-art airplanes and taking off. What exactly was a plane going to do to a ship still in outer space? Well, thatâ??s never really explained). Perhaps the only kind thing I can say aboutÂ Santa Claus Conquers the MartiansÂ is that John Call makes for a convincing Saint Nick, playing him as a jolly old man who takes everything in stride. As for the filmâ??s other characters, theyâ??re either: a. One-dimensional, b. poorly portrayed, or c. All of the above.
One of the best bad movies, complete with the perfect bad movie title.

I still very much appreciate its spirit, both in terms of no-budget
filmmaking and sense of fun. I wish that the films of today could have
even a fraction of its good-natured mischievous approach. Certainly film studios could learn a thing or two, in this ridiculous era of quarter-of-a-billion-dollar blockbusters. I for one don't need the equivalent of 'having my eyes masturbated', as one cinema critic so lovingly stated.

I would prefer watching this in a second over any of the ham-fisted,
cash-soaked holiday atrocities made in the past three decades (I
believe 'A Christmas Story', and perhaps 'Elf' and 'National Lampoon's
Christmas Vacation' to be the last decently-made Yuletide films).

But don't take MY word for it...see it for yourself (without the stupid
and condescending MST3K commentary) and make your OWN conclusion.

A cult Christmas classic, "Santa Claus Conquers the Martians" concerns Martians and their selfish, perturbed children who have no fun and hope that Santa's goodwill will come to their planet. The Martians come to Earth, kidnap some kids, then Santa, and take them back to their planet. Some of the Martians dislike the idea of letting Santa on their planet, and plot to kill him and the children, but are thwarted time and again. The film isn't inherently bad: it has a logical plot, the performances aren't all that bad, and it's message of letting kids have fun is inspiring. The reason it's so ridiculous is the premise itself. That and the costuming is horrible, like, ridiculously bad. The Martians are all in green-face, the elves are all dwarves, and the Martian children look and sound like practiced wind-up dolls. While this isn't the best bad movie it's rather entertaining and fun for the entire family, even with its constant plot device of children killing alien life forms.

"Hooray for Santy Claus!"  Extraordinarily awful and hysterically funny, Santa Claus Conquers the Martians is insanity wrapped in a bow.  The plot is beyond idiotic; finding that their children have forgotten how to play and have fun, a group of Martians go to Earth to abduct Santa Claus in the hopes that he'll be able to revive their children's spirits.  The acting is atrocious, but not as bad as the makeup and costumes, which are horrendous (even for '60s sci-fi).  Yet it's all made infinitely worse by how seriously the film takes itself.  Though it's terrible in every way possibly, Santa Claus Conquers the Martians is too ridiculous to hate and is just begging to be laughed at (which is actually kind of fun).

A hilariously bad Christmas Film that defies any logic or reason. Martians are concerned their children aren't having fun so they decide to kidnap Santa Claus.

The plot & performances are delightfully awful & it's one of those fun bad films. The sets are ridiculous & you found yourself giggling regularly.

This film is just simply entertainment & you need to appreciate for what it is. The actor playing Santa is a little strange though keep him away from the kids.

I watch the MST3K version every Black Friday, but this movie is good enough to watch by itself. Sure, the sets are cheap, there's coloration issues, obvious stock footage of military stuff, and it's generally considered a bad movie, but it has its charm. The characters are memorable in a good way (not something you can say about other movies), and it's fun to watch every year, MST3K or not.
It can be enjoyable for a cheesy low-budget movie, but it's hard to get over how terrible 'Santa Claus Conquers the Martians' is.
Really cheesy, really funny and a young Pia Zadora.
The WORST XMAS movie ever but I like it.
hilariously awful, but awful nonetheless.

Although it doesn't have as many ludicrous moments as some other great b-movies, Santa Claus Conquers the Martians is silly, cheesy, and dumb enough to entertain any fan of bad movies. With bad acting, bad effects, and just a terribly stupid plot, this b-movie is definitely one you can't pass up.
My god. The horror! The horror!

Tuesday, December 17, 2013

(1964) Santa Claus Defeats the Aliens
FAMILY SCIENCE-FICTION

 Saw this as "Santa Claus Defeats The Aliens" which  really should've been called "Ed Wood Presents Santa Claus Defeats..." since it's being defined as a very low budget feature film which is exactly how Ed Wood usually make his films.  The set up has Martians from mars with green paint on their faces questioning why their own children look so unhappy, so they devise a plan to kidnap Santa Claus from the planet earth.  And by the time they get to earth, they bump into a couple of kids and informed them that the real Santa lives in the North Pole which is exactly where they went taking along with them are the 2 children, since they had just found out their real intentions and don't like the idea of the real Santa being kidnapped.  The two kids unsuccessfully did make attempts to warn him, but was later captured by a fake looking robot which is obviously a guy wearing a fake looking robot suit sent by the Martians themselves- also their is also a guy wearing a fake looking polar bear suit who walks with his hands and knees. To say anymore would be pointless, but the thing is that I have no idea how I was able to watch this all the way through without cringing as opposed to some big budgeted movies.  And I guess it's because I've used to see my fair share of movies similar to this one during my younger years which it wouldn't take much to entertain me, meaning that low budget production costs is sometimes not a requirement to watch some of these movies intended for kids going into pre-school. Let's see, their was "Electric Company", Mister Rogers" to "Sesame Street" which it wouldn't take much to get children entertained when people are wearing fake looking costumes and bad makeup. I don't hate this since it's demographic is clearly obvious, but at the same time I don't like it either. 

2 out of 4 stars
Regarded as one of the worst movies ever made, this film is about Santa kidnapped by Martians. It only takes a few minutes to see why this film will be one of the worst you will have ever seen.
Not even "so bad it's good" kitschy, just plain bad.
This was on MST3000!
An essential Christmas classic.
Well it was pretty crappy movie even for the 1960s low budget movie all the way wasn't even funny I didn't laugh once this shows even back they didn't have good ideas

"We're going out the good ol' fashioned way. Prancer and Dancer and Donder and Blitzen, and Vixen and Nixon... oh, consarnit I get those names mixed up, but the KIDS know their names."

Typically bad 1960s sci-fi drive-in trash but twisted into a saccharine formula geared for kids.  Or stoned dogs.  Actual canines.  Stoned.  I would only wish this on my worst enemy or to those who like to watch real real bad low budget crap or those who've seen every other Christmas movie out there (every. single. one.).
It's awfulness is absolute, and only mildly enjoyable.

Wow! Boring acting. Boring script. Boring "special" effects. Everything about this is, well, boring. And the story is so crackheadedly outlandish the only way to wish you weren't dead would be to watch it intoxicated.
Better than Man of Steel.
Only episode of MST3K i could sit through
this might be the worst movie in existence, and yet i get so nostalgic about it!

This is a classic example of a bad movie. "Santa Claus Conquers the Martians" does everything wrong that concerns film production. The acting is terrible, the dialogue is terrible, and more importantly, the special effects are terrible. Yet it's enjoyably cheesy. When you watch it for the first time, you can't help but laugh at what is going on in the film. Oh, it's bad all right, but rest assured, you can get a chuckle here and there. "Santa Claus Conquers the Martians" is a bad movie, but it is definitely worth viewing.

The story is that the children of Mars have become depressed and have not experienced any fun whatsoever. So the Martians come to Earth and kidnap Santa Claus to bring joy and laughter back to the planet. That's pretty much it.

"Santa Claus Conquers the Martians" is just as silly and stupid as it may seem. The story is executed poorly. Santa Claus does not conquer the Martians, he only brings joy and happiness to the planet. The dialogue is terrible as it sounds like the actors are forcing it out of their mouths. Oh the acting; it's as bland and awful as it can get. There is no effort or amount of seriousness into the movie from the actors. There's even a moment at the beginning of the film where you can clearly tell that there is someone inside a polar bear and a robot suit.

Speaking of the special effects, everything looks fake. Take the aforementioned robot and polar bear; they are so cheap, it looks like you can see the actor inside the suit. Yes, this movie was made on a low budget, but come on, at least put some effort into the production. In fact, most of the costumes look like they were bought at a custume store. The use of stock footage is cliched and the actual effects look like they were made out of cardboard. "Santa Claus Conquers the Martians" is a notoriously bad movie.

Yet it's friggin' hilarious! This is one of those movies you just need to see to believe, and laugh at the absurdity of it all.

In conclusion, "Santa Claus Conquers the Martians" is bad, but you will still get a laugh for what it's worth.
Just down right unwatchable and ridiculously silly.
Do I even need to explain why this sucks?
Terrible film; hilarious episode of MST3k.
Best watched riffed on MST3K! Without it, you'll be pulling the hairs from the top of your head.
Awful but entertaining flick. If you can stomach awful movies, check this one out!
This film is, to put it simply, horrible.  Bad acting, plot holes, horrible set designs and costumes, and scenes that make you feel uncomfortable.  This film depressed me when I first saw it.
This movie is terrible and an instant holiday classic.
Ouch, how not be convinced that Santa doesn't exist if you end up wishing it after this film!
Absolutely horrible but MST3K makes  it a very enjoyable piece of crap movie.
It's more boring than the title would suggest.

I was hoping to at least watch Santa fight some Martians in this. After Santa fools the bad egg Martian, the movie gets even more pointless than when it started. If you want to see some of the worst filmmaking ever made, just watch the polar bear and the robot. This is one of those movies where the crew should've just went, "That's it! Enough is enough! I'm going home!"
haha... watch the MST 3K version!

This cult "classic" is about some ornery Martians who kidnap Santa Claus. They want him to bring Christmas to Martian children, but a rogue soldier has cruel intentions for St. Nick. This low budget piece of crap was famously skewered in one of the most popular episodes of Mystery Science Theater 3000. It can be a "so bad it's good" movie in some areas, but it really isn't worth seeing without Crow and Tom Servo.

I can't believe that I actually had to sit here and consider what to rate this movie. At first I gave it a half star, but I realized that I was sort of fascinated by its awfulness, and that's what made me change my mind and give it a much more honest rating. That isn't saying a lot though, because Santa Claus Conquers the Martians is just as much a piece of garbage as you've heard it to be, if you've heard of it at all. It's fascinating watching money burn on screen the way it does in this, but I can't say that I recommend it because of that. The only way I could recommend this is to refer you to the Mystery Science Theater 3000 version, which in itself, isn't all that great either. It's just bad, and not much can save it from being such.
Horrible, wierd, and obnoxious classicly done movie.
This is a funny movie!
Hilariously bad film with a story that came out of no where. The martians are down right goofy and the feel is incredibly cheap. It's down right awful, and a MST3K classic.

One of the worst films ever made. No changing it.
Pretty simple plotline: Children on Mars are bored and unhappy, so some Martians go and kidnap Santa and some kids. One specific Martian, Voldar, is planning to kill Santa and the kids against his commander's will.
I first saw this on a list of the worst films ever made, and wanted to see for myself how bad this really was. It's bad, boring, and for sure a low-budget making. It wouldn't even appeal to its targeted audience, the kids. They would be horribly bored and wouldn't get it.
Now for my hatred of the characters. First, Dropo. He is one of the most annoying and idiotic characters I've ever seen, a complete moron. Billy and his sister, Betty, are morons at acting. And Voldar- Voldar has an epic mustache.
And did you know that the guns used in the film are plastic guns painted silvers and edited noise? Not amused.

I understand the film title is 'Santa Claus Conquers The Martians', but these aliens would have to kidnap the jolly old man first. No one on Mars is receiving presents on the holidays so when the kids are glued to the TV set showing Earth programs the plan is carried out. And coming along with Santa are two Earth kids "vanished into thin air" before Christmas Eve. This is another case of cheesy campfest I've ever watched, and the opening and closing song is somewhat the corniest tune I've ever heard in such film. If the studio sets here are too cheap to produce, so is the budget. My verdict? I actually like this campfest.

Despite, or because of, the cheapness of the production, "Santa Claus Conquers the Martians" charms with its can-do pluckiness. And the fun and catchy opening theme song is a winner that really deserves more exposure. Those initial charms run thin too soon though, and along about the one hour mark (though your mileage may vary) those charm points have expired and the movie ultimately fails to offer any renewal of those charms for too long a time before coming to an end. 

Love the song, though.

One of the cheapest looking movies ever made. The sets look as phoney as those masks you buy at the dollar store. You could get this as a present for Christmas or a lump of coal...it's easy to tell which one is worse. I have to say this movie is! Pia Zadora's screen debut and she also sings the silly theme song "Santy Claus".

"All this trouble over a fat man in a red suit!" 

Martian kids are feeling down :( 
WHY, you ask? Because they have no Christmas celebrations on Mars! After watching Earth programming on TV they discover the magic of the holidays and it soon grows in popularity among the planet's children. In attempts to end the silliness, a Martian expedition sets out to the North Pole to kidnap Santa Claus. But along the way complications occur when they also kidnap two children attempt to persuade them to not go through with the job through the magic of Christmas cheer. 

Take your pick.... Plan 9, Manos, The Room, Garbage Pail Kids... take your pick. There are so many horrible movies out there, intentional or otherwise. But there is no other movie that truely fails then this film of merry and bright. And yet none of them quite wins like this film either. It's just so horrible that it's actually quite amusing. Anything that can go wrong WILL go wrong. From stage-hands walking in, bad acting, misspelling, awkward plotholes with props as well as story.... it's all there. It's ALL there. But nonetheless it's rather amusing how silly it can be if you love your b-movies. This film is quite unavoidable. See it. Now.

are you serious?!  of all the movies i select to watch, this comes on.  tickle ray?  santa doesn't know if there's life on mars?  martians watching (silly) earth programs - that confuse them?  food pills (of earth food)?  sleep spray?  this is ridiculous.  and so is the makeup.

"...all this trouble over a fat little man in a red suit."

speaking of which, nice polar bear suit.  "...oh me, oh my, oh me, oh my; mrs. claus isn't going to like this..."  hmmm, a martian-mellow.  and slinky makes a cameo!

all in all, it's a true mst3k flick.  i find it hard to believe there was any entertainment value in the movie, but you get a â~... for trying.
Santa Claus Conquers the Martians suffers from an uneven case of poor acting, cheesy special effects, and mediocre dialogue.

To start of watching Christmas specials, I picked a movie that's so bad it's wonderful. If you're willing to take the risk, go for the straight version. However, there exist cuts from Mystery Science Theater 3000 and Cinematic Titanic to soften the blow.
Terrible and inexcusable. Why was this made? The MST3K episode was pretty good--particularly the parts with Crow talking about his love for "Road House."

Ridiculous Holiday/Science Fiction/Fantasy B-movie about Martians who decide they want Christmas too and steal Santa from Earth.  The movie is just terrible, but it can be quite fun if you want a laugh.
At least they tried...I think.
amazing! great acting! Realistic effects! Good plot!  Should've won best picture!!

Imagine yourself as a young child playing by the train tracks.  You look and see a lose rail, an imminent danger, and approaching is a massive train filled with passengers.  There's nothing you can do, and you just watch as the train heads towards it's destruction, and as it swerves off the tracks, destruction is released.  Screams of pain echo endlessly, fires bursting, engines exploding, sights more horrible than the mind can fathom.  And all you can do is sit their and watch.  Decency tells you to look away, but something draws you in, creepily watching all the destruction, unable to turn your head, as if you want to see just how horrible things could possibly get.

That's kinda' what it's like to watch this movie.
This is one of the worst movies ever made, and certainly the worst holiday flick ever. Grade: F

Now, this movie is very cheesey. The plot is very original and it's actually kinda good. Everything else, however, is below average. Well, except for one thing. John Call was GREAT as Santa Claus. I love how he's positive even when times are tough. Plus, this movie has the catchiest christmas I heard in a long time. Kids might enjoy this movie, but some of the parts might be boring or confusing for them. Sure, the effects were bad and most of the cast is below average, but it's an enjoyable film. If you are looking for a cheesey movie and don't mind the strange jokes and silly scenes, you might just enjoy this movie.
This movie is awesome!!!!! It's very cute any funny.
This movie has it moments but not the best movie i'v seen. i watched it here. http://www.hulu.com/watch/112508/santa-claus-conquers-the-martians
Tries to be heartwarming but ends up being just plain creepy instead. Worth watching for the unintentional hilarity though.
So bad it's entertaining. However it is also not the best worst movie out there.

This is one of those movies that need to be watched if you like low budget camp classics. The script is bad and the budget is beyond low. This would fall under the category of being so bad it is entertaining.
So bad it looks like a live television play by an amateur dramatics society who have only had 24 hours to see the script - at first it feels like a Saturday Night Live skit.

A curiously bad film that tries to be sweet and heartwarming. Of course, it is really an incompetent mess of a production that has very few redeeming characteristics.

But, the one redeeming characteristic that I really want to start with is, believe it or not, the actor who plays Santa Claus himself. He is played by the relatively competent John Call. It's a shame he never really became anything. I'm pretty sure that this film annihilated his career, but I feel like he could have made a decent living portraying Santa Claus for the rest of his life. Sure, that would have been a terrible life, but he already did this film. After that, there's not really a long ways down.

But besides that one actor, every other aspect of this movie is just an embarrassment. The sets look stupid, the makeup effects are dreadful, and the actors are annoying as hell. One such character is Dropo who is so incredibly irritating that I'm surprised the other Martians didn't push him into the vacuum of space on their way to the planet Earth.

Now the plot of this movie makes about as much sense as the title does. No, this is not a movie in which Santa Claus gears up his machine guns and starts slaughtering evil Martian invaders. Instead, the Martians take Santa to Mars and force--erm, politely ask--him to make every Martian toys for Christmas. It's not much of a plot, but, then again, this isn't much of a movie. It's tedious and dragging and doesn't keep consistent with what's going on in the story, but, hell, I have to admit it tries. The fact that the audience can even *tell* that it's trying to be heartwarming must mean something.

Here's my question with a movie like this: how does a person sit down a typewriter, write out this film, and genuinely expects it to be a good film? How does that even happen? How can they possibly write out scenario after scenario of Santa Claus talking to Martians and expects it to be worth anything more than an hour's worth of laughs by some college kids with nothing else better to do on a Monday night? This is a movie that feels like the product of an empty stomach and a producer who just couldn't possibly know any better. I can't hate this film, of course. But I do dislike it very much.

I'm sure nothing I say is going to sway people one way or the other with this film. People who want to see just how bad a bad film can be and then laugh at it are going to see it. People who will never touch this film with a ten-foot pole are still going to stay away from it. Which do I recommend? Well, it is worth the laugh to see it, especially since it costs next to nothing to find a copy of it (a friend of mine was able to buy the film for a dime). At the same time, though, it doesn't really add anything to one's understanding of bad filmmaking. Everything about it just kind of hits the "basic incompetence" mark. I mean, yes, everything about it is DREADFULLY incompetent, but there's nothing about this film that really stands out. Probably its worst quality, in fact, is the way it seems to pass through one part of the audience's brain and out the next without ever hitting home with anything. It can be incredibly annoying, but that's only half the time. The rest of the film is either comically bad or simply stupid, and neither is really grounds for labeling this catastrophe as one of the absolute worst films ever made. But, yeah, it still definitely sucks and isn't entertaining in the least.
1/10
(drop cigar) what the heck was that?

Barely worth watching except for the curious, this shabby idea of a movie could have been made by any high school drama class.  Martians are losing their children's attention to the legend of Santa Claus.

It seems Christmas is the reason for the Martian's problems with their kids.  The Martians kidnap Santa because there is nobody on Mars to give their children presents.

Cast
John Call 
Leonard Hicks 
Vincent Beck 
Bill McCutcheon 
Victor Stiles 
Donna Conforti 
Pia Zadora 

Crew
Director: Nicholas Webster 
Cinematographer: David L. Quaid 
Composer: Milton Delugg 
Producer: Paul L. Jacobson 
Producer: Joseph E. Levine 
Producer: Arnold Leeds 
Screenplay: Paul L. Jacobson 
Screenplay: Glenville Mareth 
Editor: William Henry
Never take acid before making a Christmas movie... But oddly, this has more charm than a lot of Christmas movies out there.

This film is so bad it is good.   You should go into this movie knowing that there is not one redeeming quality about it, but sometimes you need to watch a movie which doesn't require any thinking.  So, hooray for Santa Claus!

Madness abounds in this ill-conceived, poorly-written and horribly-shot chaotic mess of cheesy Christmas goodness and hilariously low-budget charm. I shan't recommend it but I confess I took a liking to it.

This one of those movies one can categorize as "so bad it's good" but I must add that it really resembles a Lollywood flick, yes it's just as shitty, but has a charm to it or is it just the awe in which the spectator will be amazed scene after scene asking him or herself "how did they?" to end with "how the hell did I even watch this piece of crap?".

Yes, it's terrible and I don't recommend it, but if you happen to come across it beware, cos you're certain to stick through it all the way to the end.

I deserve a full star for the balls shown by not throwing it in a bonfire.

A reallyy bad idea. The movie is boring and not well mae AT ALL. Only one part of the entire movie is unitennalionlly funny(and boy is that part funny). I dont recommened seeing this but i do recommened seeing the Ms3k episode that riffs this.

I just happened to catch this movie on TV the other night, unfortunately.  It's got an interesting story, which may have been the inspiration for Disney's new movie Mars Needs Moms, because in this movie the kids of mars need a Santa.  This movie is complete cheese, with bad actors, dialogue, special effects, directing,  the works!  An interesting bad movie, though.
the worst christmas movie ever
Wow. I'm not sure what to say. Oh wait, yes I do - I'll never watch this again!

Someone must  have been under the influence when they can up w/ the plot for this movie.  Martian children are unhappy so their parents kidnap Santa Clause.  You  would figure w/ a concept that bad that it there would have bad charms.  There isn't.  It's excessively cheap & John Call can't even get Santa Claus's laugh right.  It's HO HO HO you dumb bastard.  Also the worst Martians this side of Uranus except Boldor as the menace of the group.  He hates Xmas just as much as I do & will kidnap Santa & do away w/ him before the alien children can enjoy Santa's toys. How this doesn't belong on the IMDB's bottom 100 is beyond me
The most unholy piece of Christmas crap ever. Happy Holidays

Now, this movie is very cheesey. The plot is very original and it's actually kinda good. Everything else, however, is below average. Well, except for one thing. John Call was GREAT as Santa Claus. I love how he's positive even when times are tough. Plus, this movie has the catchiest christmas I heard in a long time. Kids might enjoy this movie, but some of the parts might be boring or confusing for them. Sure, the effects were bad and most of the cast is below average, but it's an enjoyable film. If you are looking for a cheesey movie and don't mind the strange jokes and silly scenes, you might just enjoy this movie.
Easily the worst movie I've ever seen in my life. Watch it.
Santa's too jolly for it to be normal.
With the exception of the laughably bad Polar Bear costume, there is nothing enjoy in this obnoxiously cheesy movie.

If you took a director with an idea to mix sci-fi with Christmas, stir in a couple of D-list actors, and some of your local community theater rep company, (including the lighting, sound and set construction crews) and put them together to do a Christmas story, this would be the result. It's so incredibly inept and lame, yet you can see it, plain as day: They were utterly sincere! It was somebody's belief that it would be a hit, and it was someone's labor of love.

It's like those people on American Idol that can't sing, and are completely deluded, that's how bad it is. Someone ought to have told them. Someone ought to have accidentally lost the negatives.

But wait, Santa Claus Conquers the Martians gave life to a really good episode of MST3K; so that's one positive. It has a happy ending, that's two positives. It's really very inoffensive, that's three positives. 

In fact, it's risen above how bad it is to become a really enjoyable thing to watch at the sheer awfulness. In other words, it really does have some of the Christmas spirit in it: It will make you laugh, or at least you'll be able to fall asleep on Christmas Eve watching it, with visions of really creepy guys in green suits and bad makeup dancing in your head.

I give it 10% because it's 100% better than a zero for comic relief. Apologies to the West Minnetonka Community Theater Company for making fun of their sets. (They disavow all knowledge of this film)

PS DO NOT show this film to your kids. They may be permanently scarred, and become somewhat Scrooge-like in their later years.
This movie's isn't bad, it just feels weird, it's like Manos The Hands Of Fate, but luckily MST3K did this in the christmas episode.
Boy, MST3K knows how to pick em...
Not too bad at all!  I thought it would be a total bomb.  I actually enjoyed it and the theme song!  HOORAY FOR SANTY CLAUS!  LOL!
Of course, the MST3K riffing of this movie gets FIVE stars *****
The worst Christmas movie I've ever seen. But watch it anyway because it's hilarious.

As if making non-traditional X-Mas films can be any weirder than this one. The jokes were lame and the idea of Mars not having XMas, and the martians obducting Santa and 2 minors to Mars doesn't make a great XMas movie if you ask me. The worst part would have to be the fake Polar Bear which is obviously a man in a costume. This is a bad example for a good XMas film, however the 1959 Santa Claus film was much worst than this one.
A must see for anybody that hates life. Generally considered to be one of the worst movies of all time, and it really deserves it. Includes everything bad.

A true classic of terrible cinema, Santa Claus Conquers the Martians really has to be seen to be believed. How anyone thought that kids would love this Christmas film is beyond me, it's diabolical throughout. Opening with the cheesiest Christmas song you will ever hear, it doesn't get any better as we are treated to awful acting, hilarious dialogue, the cheapest looking sets you will ever see and the worst looking cardboard box robot ever featured in a film.

The plot is hilarious, the kids of Mars are all sad as they are not allowed to have a proper childhood due the seriousness of everyone on Mars. The Martians (people with terrible black face paint and an antennae hat on) decide to kidnap Santa to make the kids happy. However mutiny happens within the Martian team so it's up to Santa and two annoying kids to save the day and inspire the Martians to mend their ways.

The whole thing looks like it was made for a fiver The Martian guns are hysterical, they make a popping sound which renders people paralyzed. All sets are made with cardboard, plot points are started then completely forgotten about and the climatic battle scene involves the Martian baddy being bombarded with bubble guns and paper airplanes.

Hilarious from start to finish but truly awful.
Super cheesy movie, but for 1964, it was cute for kids.
Not that bad, for an utter cheesefest

A true classic of terrible cinema, Santa Claus Conquers the Martians really has to be seen to be believed. How anyone thought that kids would love this christmas film is beyond me, it's diabolical thorughout. Opening with the cheesist christmas song you will ever hear, it doesn't get any better as we are treated to awful acting, hilarious dialogue, the cheapest looking sets you will ever see and the worst looking cardboard box robot ever featured in a film.

The plot is hilarious, the kids of Mars are all sad as they are not allowed to have a proper childhod due the seriousnes sof everyone on Mars. The Martians (people with terrible black facepaint and an antenae hat on) decide to kidnap Santa to make the kids happy. However mutiny happens within the martian team so it's up to Santa and two annoying kids to save the day and inspire the Martians to mend their ways.

The whole thing looks like it was made for a fiver The Martian guns are hysterical, they make a popping sound which renders people paralysed. All sets are made with cardboard, plot points are started then completely forgotten about and the climatic battle scene involes the Martian baddy being bombarded with bubble guns and paper aeroplanes.

Hilarious from start to finish but truly awful.

Officially the worst film, Christmas or otherwise I've ever seen, even worse than 88 Minutes. Hell i'll even watch a Julia Roberts movie than see this, it's Ho Ho Horrible. The Tom Selleck Cameo wannabe blows, tons of stock footage and even Hercules in New York looks like a masterpiece compared to this train wreck.

It's not even funny bad, I had to apologize to many for screening this moronic effort. Embarrasing! Only watch during half price Beer night to get full enterainment value!
So bad it's mental. Might be good while high...
I kept waiting for Santa to conquer the Martians with force, but it never happens

Ouch. Bad, very bad. Thank Kris Kringle for the MST3k version. Best line not in the film by Crow T. Robot about his XMAS wish: " I want to decide who lives and dies." Acting note this is Pia Zadora's best work.

This seems to have been made to be bad -- probably part of 60's camp phenomena. It would probably be decent background filler for a swanky christmas party, but I'm pretty sure no joy can be found from paying attention to the whole thing.
Has to be the worst movie that I have ever seen.

It may have some Christmasy stuff, but this fails to be good. Its about in the planet Mars, the Martian captain Keemar worries that his Martian children watch a lot of "Earth TV" so he and his sidekicks go to Earth and kidnap Santa Claus and 2 kids, a 10 yr boy named Billy and his 8 yr old sister Betty and are taken to Mars.

The movie looks terrible. The polar bear's mouth doesn't move and there are exposed stuff in the mask. In my opinion, its over acted. Pia Zidora got a Raspberry award for Worst Actress, no wonder she quit. And I find the villains to be pretty lame. Especially Voldar (awesome name), he has the worst evil laugh ever. Here's one character that made me jump to the ceiling. Dropo. I know he's supposed to be a happy kind of guy, but all he does is act like a dumbnut. 

One worst scene. When Santa comes in, cracking up even a funny joke, the Martian children laugh non stop. Even the finger joke didn't make me at least crack a smile. I muttered "Ha ha, very funny. Shut up". 

The opening and the closing music makes me want to get a chainsaw and saw off my ears with it, but how will that affect my dream career as a movie actress when I can't even hear what the director tells me to do? To cure it, I am listening to Evanescence and Vienna Teng.

The only good thing about this movie that it has its Christmas spirit so I give it at least a 10% even though I sounded like I'm being too hard.
This movie is every bit as bad as you would think. That is exactly why it makes such good fodder for MST3K. Merry Christmas!
Christmas Story and This Movie is what I will be watching Christmas Eve!  Can Be found for 5 bucks or Less!  Watch it just for the Catchy theme song! They Horaay for Santie Claus! Yes Santie Claus!
This is probably the worst movie I have ever seen in my entire life... Even for a kids movie. I gave it 4 and a half stars because I saw the Svengoolie version of it.
more cheese than a Packer's game, but it is oh-so-tasty awesome cheese.
this movie alone would kill any little kids xmas cheer

I'm really surprised to not see Ed Wood's name not attached to this garbage. I wish I would have seen the MST3K version because at least I would have had a laugh. This really is one of the worst movies every made. From horrible costumes, bad set and even worse acting, I would have liked to have been a fly on the wall when they were showing this movie to the studio exec that green lighted this. This is even a bad movie for children.

Great title and great polar bear. Funny robot and fistfights
The rest is just a stupid old childrens movie
The title is misleading...Santa does no such conquering
You must watch the MST3K episode that features this episode.
This movie wasn't even an epic fail, it was just fail.  How sad.
Unintentionally hilarious.

This movie is such complete nonsense. It makes pretty good viewing if you're making fun of it with a friend, but as far as actual quality of movie goes... well, there isn't any. Also, be forewarned: At no point does any conquering actually happen during this movie. I know I, for one, was quite disappointed by that.

Santa Claus conquers the Martians is one of the oddest and most unusual films I've ever seen, even for a Christmas film. Every single performance is over-acted and the story makes no sense whatsoever. While it does have the common Christmas Spirit that Christmas films are notable for, Santa Claus Conquer the Martians fails to be a decent film.

"Hooray for Santy Claus!"  That's the main lyric in the theme song for this movie  and it certainly is catchy.  The rest of the movie feels so disjointed it's no wonder IMDB lists this as the only movie written by the 2 writers of this masterpiece and one of the 50 worst movies ever made.
Martian children who watch Earth TV (?) are upset that they have no Santa.  Their wise elder has foreseen this and says Christmas must come to Mars.  So of course, Martians kidnap Santa.  Boredom ensues.
There didn't feel to be any cohesiveness with the story as it sort of goes from one plot point to another, to another, clumsily.  

Note the same scene stock footage of the Air Force in Dr. Strangelove was used in this movie.
i laughed so hard during this movie i nearly pissed myself

As soon as the movie started playing we get a chorus of children cheering on Santa Claus. Tune is catchy I admit it and couldn't help but laugh. I was hoping to see a movie where Santa goes and beats down on a few little green men. Turns out martian children are addicted to Earth's TV shows that contain Santa Claus. So what do the martian parents do? Head to Earth and kidnap the fat, red suited, jolly man. These green aliens snatch up two kids to lead them to Santa Claus. You know those cheesy robot outfits that are basically a silver box with painted tubes for limbs? Yea, there is one of those there too. CLASSIC! So Santa's fat rear is kidnapped and taken to Mars where Santa meets the Mar's children and starts laughing and keeps laughing till the kids do the same. A very odd scene. Upon further investigation, Santa finds out that the martians have no intention on letting him leave. Damn aliens, go get your own obese white guy. Apparently some of the martians try to do away with Santa, thinking it is making their people soft with toys and not weapons. Santa uses the power of "holly jolly yuletide goodness" and beats the martians. At the very end of the credits is a sing along with the theme. I think the punishment for singing this in public is 3 lashing. Goofy and far fetched movie. Not a must see but a good one to run in the background at a Christmas party, just to see the faces of the guests.
This is what happens when people don't leave cookies for Santa.

Sometimes movie are just so bad, they can't even be watched. This is a kids movie which looks like it was made by a bunch of kids using their allowance and lunch money to fund it. This is like a junior high audio visual production of the worst idea ever. Santa Claus is captured by Martians who need him to make their kids happy, but soon hear that Santa Claus may be a threat to Martian life. How? I don't know and neither does this movie? Like Plan 9 From Outer Space, this movie edits stock footaged in between bad actors walking around cheap seats. Maybe with the quick wit of MST3K, this movie may have been enjoyable as a way to waste 90 minutes, but this is terrible. There is a scene involving a polar bear that has to be scened to be believed. It's just a guy in a bear suit and a cheap bear suit at that.
Because even aliens have the spirit of Christmas!!!

Oh goodness, what a great camp classic! Honestly, how can you seriously take a movie called "Santa Clause Conquers the Martians" as anything short of a silly, so-bad-it's-good time? A must-watch around the holidays, with or without the MST3K crew.
Good enough to make fun of and laugh at with friends
An odd movie. The plot and storyline themselves are both quite poor. Santa fighting martians isn't exactly what I call holiday spirit. Definitely skip it.

In the right company and with loads of "adult" beverages, this one could be a scream. But watch it alone and you'd wish you were dead just to escape a world that would allow crap like this to be produced.
There is no holiday spirit in this movie whatsoever.
